thread.title: Things to take from Pia, our kween
thread.title_full: Things to take from Pia, our kween

title: Things to take from Pia, our kween

persons.name: sabi nga niya kay tito boy

text:
Things to take from Pia, our kween 06:29   
1 Laban nang laban —nang laban. 
Three times, mga besh! Laban lungs! ADVERTISEMENT 
2 Share the crown. 
From the time her crown was accidentally put over Colombia’s head, to the interviews where she gamely shared it to anyone who asked about it, to her #Crowned initiative, don’t make it about the crown. One, don’t be materialistic. Two, nobody wants a stage-hogger. 
3 But mark your territory din, ’teh. 
Sabi nga niya kay Tito Boy: “He’s mine.” Back off! 
4 And then make jokes about it, because your sense of humor is superior. 
The bit where she handed a pair of eyeglasses to Steve Harvey was gold. 
5 Which brings us to another lesson: Forgive. 
Pakawalan mo na. As what happened to the most popular Miss Universe, it’s all for the best. 
6Be normal, be yourself; be relatable. 
Go play “Pokémon Go,” din. 
7Help make someone’s dream come true. It’s easy. Sagutin mo na manliligaw mo. Tsar. 
8Make it happen. Proof: Jan. 30. 
9Filipino-first policy. 
You will see two preferences in the photo—“sangkap Pinoy” (half-Pinoy) and “gawang Pinoy.” The latter is our point. She put the spotlight on local designers and the country. 
10“With a heart,” always. 
She’s championed many things—from HIV advocacy to women empowerment to helping kids achieve a normal life. She spoke against bullying and body-shaming. As Ate Krissy says: “Love, love, love!” —Vaughn Alviar
